item.title: 市场飙升，中国严查小型银行的债券购买行为
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国监管机构正在对地区性银行的债券投资进行严格审查，因为他们担心这些银行是在投机证券，而不是通过贷款来促进经济发展。【原文：Chinese regulators are scrutinizing regional banks’ bond investments amid concern that they are speculating on the securities rather than lending to boost the economy, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.description: 两年前，资金经理们曾在几个月内从埃及撤资约 200 亿美元，现在他们会发现，新兴市场中几乎没有什么地方比埃及更诱人了。【原文：Money managers who pulled some $20 billion from Egypt in a matter of months two years ago will now find few places in emerging markets more alluring.】

item.title: 南非经常账户缺口扩大幅度超过预期
item.description: 2023 年第四季度，南非经常账户赤字的扩大幅度超过预期，原因是向外国投资者支付的股息和利息导致了自 2022 年第二季度以来最大的资金外流。【原文：South Africa’s current-account deficit widened more than expected in the fourth quarter of 2023, as dividend and interest payments to foreign investors resulted in the biggest outflow since the second quarter of 2022.】

item.title: 挪威建议反对与以色列定居点开展贸易和商业活动
item.description: 挪威政府正在阻止本国公司开展有助于维持以色列定居点的贸易和商业活动，以强调其现有立场。【原文：The Norwegian government is discouraging the country’s companies from conducting trade and business activities that contribute to the maintenance of the Israeli settlements, underlining its existing stance.】

item.title: 中国黄金消费达到第 16 个月，价格屡创新高
item.description: 1 月份，中国央行连续第 16 个月增加黄金储备，延续了长期以来的购买热潮，为贵金属飙升至历史新高提供了支持。【原文：China’s central bank added gold to its reserves for a 16th straight month in January, extending a long buying spree that’s helped to support the precious metal’s surge to a record high.】

item.title: 日本最高工会组织要求实现 30 年来最高工资涨幅
item.description: 日本最大的工会联合会提出了自 1993 年以来最大的加薪要求，这进一步加剧了人们对日本央行可能在 3 月份采取自 2007 年以来首次加息行动的猜测。【原文：Japan’s biggest union federation demanded its biggest pay hike since 1993, adding further fuel to speculation that the nation’s central bank may move in March to raise interest rates for the first time since 2007.】

item.description: 对于被卷入印度不断扩大的打击金融业行动的金融公司来说，这又是令人心惊肉跳的一周。【原文：It’s been another heart-stopping week for financial firms caught up in India’s widening crackdown on the sector.】

item.title: 欧洲央行决议成为关注焦点，欧洲股市从创纪录水平回落
item.description: 欧洲股市在创下历史纪录后下跌，因为投资者转而在法兰克福寻找欧洲央行利率路径的线索，该央行可能会保持借贷成本稳定。【原文：European stocks fell after notching a record as investors turn to Frankfurt for clues on European Central Bank’s interest rates path, with the central bank likely to keep borrowing costs steady.】

item.title: 布雷万-霍华德（Brevan Howard）将阿布扎比前哨打造成价值 100 亿美元的枢纽
item.description: 布雷万-霍华德资产管理公司（Brevan Howard Asset Management）已将阿布扎比打造成其最大的风险承担中心，提升了该市作为新兴对冲基金中心的形象。【原文：Brevan Howard Asset Management has turned Abu Dhabi into its biggest risk-taking center, burnishing the city’s image as an emerging hedge fund hub.】

item.title: 英国保险公司 Aviva 计划回购 3 亿英镑股票
item.description: 英国英杰华保险公司（Aviva Plc）表示，随着销售额和营业利润的增长，该公司计划回购 3 亿英镑的股票。【原文：UK insurer Aviva Plc said it plans to buy back £300 million of shares following growth in sales and operating profit.】

item.title: 保险公司寻求私人债务解决方案，中国万科压力增大

item.title: 顾问称印度 GDP 意外增长并非唯一因素
item.description: 印度政府最高经济顾问表示，印度上一季度 8%以上的经济增长不仅仅是由一次性因素驱动的，此前有经济学家指出该数据掩盖了潜在增长势头的放缓。【原文：India’s 8%-plus growth last quarter was driven by more than just one-off factors, the government’s top economic adviser said, after economists pointed out that the data masked slowing underlying momentum.】

item.title: 消息人士称，李小龙电影工作室正考虑出售新加坡影院

item.title: 德国工厂订单大幅下滑，主要订单减少
item.description: 德国工厂订单在 12 月出现回升后，在 2024 年初大幅下降，这凸显了欧洲最大经济体难以克服近期的萎靡不振。【原文：German factory orders dropped sharply at the start of 2024 following an uptick in December – underscoring the difficulties of Europe’s largest economy to overcome its recent malaise.】

item.description: 最近几天，中国对从波斯湾运载原油的油轮的预订量有所上升，有迹象表明，在红海航运中断的情况下，中国这个最大的进口国正在从该地区采购更多原油。【原文：Chinese bookings for tankers carrying crude oil from the Persian Gulf have risen in recent days, adding to signs that the biggest importer is sourcing more from the area amid shipping disruptions in the Red Sea.】
